resources.string: This app is for medical usage only
You are invited to fill in the questionnaire provided by the clinician. This app is for medical use only and your personal details will be secured and kept in privacy according to law.
Here are some basic pointers on using touch screens. (Pg 1 of 4)
Here are some basic pointers on using touch screens. (Pg 2 of 4)
Here are some basic pointers on using touch screens. (Pg 3 of 4)
Here are some basic pointers on using touch screens. (Pg 4 of 4)
If you wish to select a button or a text box on the screen just tap it with your finger.
If you tap on a text box, a keyboard will appear on your touchscreen. You can use this to type, just like a real keyboard on a computer.
To zoom in, place two fingers together on the screen (most people use their first finger and thumb) and pull them away from each other.
To zoom out, place two fingers apart on the screen (most people use their first finger and thumb) and bring them closer to each other.
Here are some of the input types used in this questionnaire. (Pg 1 of 2)
Here are some of the input types used in this questionnaire. (Pg 2 of 2)
Text Box: Allows a user to enter in text using the on-screen keyboard.
Radio Button: Allows a user to choose only one of a pre-defined set of options.
Checkbox: Allows the user to either choose a yes (checked) or no (blank) response to a given statement.
Choose from List: A menu of options that appears below the item when the computer user clicks on it. An option from the list may be selected.
Slider: Allows a user to set a value by moving the indicator in the horizontal or vertical direction.
